metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7560 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The SMB1 implementation in smbd in Samba 3.x and 4.x before 4.1.23, 4.2.x before 4.2.9, 4.3.x before 4.3.6, and 4.4.x before 4.4.0rc4 allows remote authenticated users to modify arbitrary ACLs by using a UNIX SMB1 call to create a symlink, and then using a non-UNIX SMB1 call to write to the ACL content.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python-samba - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.6+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
